system-grpc-server-config.description: Configuration data for the gRPC server

enable.description:
Enables the gRPC server. The gRPC server is enabled by
default

port.description: TCP port on which the gRPC server should listen

transport-security.description:
Use gRPC transport security (e.g., TLS or SSL). Enabled by default.
This allows disabling transport security for use cases where it is not
needed like lab testing.

certificate-id.description: The certificate ID to be used for authentication

metadata-authentication.description:
Enables gRPC METADATA authentication. See
https://github.com/openconfig/reference/blob/master/rpc/gnmi/gnmi-authentication.md#credentials-and-authentication
for more info.

items.description:
The IP addresses that the gRPC server should listen
on. This may be an IPv4 or an IPv6 address

system-grpc-server-top.description: Top-level grouping for system gRPC server data

grpc-server.description: Top-level container for the gRPC server

config.description: Configuration data for the system gRPC server

state.description: Operational state data for the system gRPC server
